results.title: The Genetic takeover
results.creator_credit: Karl Parent, Louise Vandelac, Eric Michel and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: In just a few short years, genetically modified plants have become part of our daily diet and are already found in 75% of processed foods. This revolution has occurred without consumer awareness and without the knowledge of potential risks to our health and the environment. In response to consumer demands, many European and Asian countries have instituted mandatory labelling of genetically modified foods. North America and Canada however, have been slow to react. This video takes a sober look at a potentially explosive situation. It investigates the issue that industrial giants are willing to ignore basic safety rules in their relentless fight for profits and asks the question: Can food crops, a vital element of the collective wealth of this planet, remain at the mercy of private interests?
results.creator_credit_for_label: Karl Parent, Louise Vandelac, Eric Michel and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: The Gathering flame [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Don Murray, Roland Beckett and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: The sea has a certain fascination for Australians. Although it is a large dry contitnent, most Australians live close to the sea. This film makes magnificent use of the sea as a background to the work of designing, building and servicing the variety of navigational aids off the coast of Australia, particularly the work of the ships of Cape Pillar, Cape Morton and Cape Don. An interesting split screen effect has been employed in this fast moving colourful documenatry. Commentary by John Laws.

results.title: The Gathering
results.creator_credit: Randal Kleiser, Harry R Sherman and Hanna-Barbera Productions
results.brief_description: This feature length film made for television is a Christmas story with a difference. Adam Thornton (Ed Asner) walked out on his family years ago to focus his energies on his business career, leaving a wife and four children - two sons and two daughters. Thornton is a gruff, hard-headed man who finds out just before Christmas that he has a terminal illness and only a few weeks to live. On telling his estranged wife, Kate (Maureen Stapleton), it is agreed that a family reunion should take place over Christmas, but only on the proviso that his imminent death is not disclosed to his now four adult children. The story avoids a “sugary-sweet” tone by exploring the interaction between Thornton and each of his family members as he attempts to tentatively reconcile the past. He soon discovers that not everyone is totally forgiving but it is his wife who is the anchor, who holds the family together. Ed Asner and Maureen Stapleton are excellent in their roles and are accompanied by a very able support cast including Sarah Cunningham, Bruce Davison, Veronica Hamel, Gregory Harrison, Lawrence Pressman, John Randolph, Gail Strickland, Stephanie Zimbalist. (Awards: Emmy for Outstanding Special - Drama or Comedy, 1978)
results.creator_credit_for_label: Randal Kleiser, Harry R Sherman and Hanna-Barbera Productions

results.title: The gay men's guide to safer sex (E)
results.creator_credit: David Lewis, James MacKay, Basilisk Productions and Terrence Higgins Trust
results.brief_description: A documentary produced by gay men for gay men offering information on HIV and AIDS and exploring the boundaries and possibilities of safe consensual sex. Using a straightforward presentation sexual information is offered in an unintimidating manner. Includes information on using condoms effectively, how to have safe oral sex and how to avoid transmission of blood and semen in S/M sex play. WARNING: CONTAINS EXPLICIT SEXUAL MATERIAL.

results.title: Whales, dolphins and men (D)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Horizon”.
Dolphins and whales share a common ancestor; yet dolphins are the darlings of the public, while whales are the victims of commercial exploitation. The dolphin is considered man’s friend and playmate, the whale continues to be a victim of exploitation and face a very real danger of extinction. Discusses scientific studies of these marine mammals. Note: Some scenes may be offensive to animal lovers.

results.title: The Funniest man in the world
results.creator_credit: Vernon P. Becker and Mel May
results.brief_description: A nostalgic look at the life and times of Charlie Chaplin, still considered to be one of the funniest and best slapstick actors in motion picture history. Born in London on 16 April 1889, to parents of music hall fame who were later to divorce, Charlie lived a fairly harsh existence with his mother and older brother Sidney. However Charlie, attracted to the world of stage, finds himself by his early teens winning parts in the stage plays “Jim, a romance of cockney” and “Sherlock Holmes”. It is not long before Chaplin ends up in the United States joining Mack Sennet’s Keystone Films, and the rest, as they say, is history. Narrated by Douglas Fairbanks, Jr this documentary follows Chaplin’s career featuring excerpts from many of his films, including “A Night out”, “The Tramp”, “The Immigrant”, Easy Street” among others and starring such actors as Roscoe “Fatty Arbuckle, Marie Dressler, Douglas Fairbanks, Oliver Hardy, Mary Pickford, Mack Swain and Ben Turpin. The film also includes additional unused new scenes and rare archival newsreel footage of Chaplin in Hollywood with Stan Laurel, Chaplin at 16 and in a UK Music Hall. The “Little Tramp” lives on.

results.title: Tracey and Trevor
results.creator_credit: Ian Munro, Sandra Richardson, Tom Manefield and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “I myself”
Tracey and Trevor discuss how they feel about being a girl and a boy. They reveal their own values and comment on the expectations and prejudices of others, including their friends family and society. The film looks at conflicts faced by children who do not wish to conform to commonly-held sex-role stereotypes.

results.title: The Crab nebula (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Alec Nisbett and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Horizon”.
Discusses the research being carried out on the Crab Nebula, and examines the deductions that astronomers are making from the results of their studies.
